meanings.definition: Wasabis: plural form of wasabi, a pungent green Japanese condiment made from the root of the wasabi plant.
meanings.sent1: The sushi chef added wasabis to the plate of sashimi.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the spicy kick that wasabis give to my sushi.
meanings.sent3: The wasabis at the Japanese restaurant were so strong they made my eyes water.
meanings.sent4: The wasabis in the dish were like tiny bursts of flavor exploding in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The wasabis looked innocent but packed a powerful punch of heat.

meanings.definition: Wasabis: third person singular past tense of the verb 'wasabi', to add wasabi to something.
meanings.sent1: She wasabis the soup before serving it to the guests.
meanings.sent2: He wasabis the noodles to give them an extra zing.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally wasabis the dessert, creating a surprisingly tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The way she wasabis the dishes shows her unique culinary style.
meanings.sent5: Adding wasabis to the dish was like adding a secret ingredient that elevated the flavor.
